intro: Behen praealtum, commonly known as the greater celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its basal leaves that are broadly heart-shaped and its yellow flowers with five sepals and petals. The plant produces a milky latex sap, which contains various alkaloids and has been used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas across Europe and parts of Asia. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and historically valuable in herbal practices.
